name: The Brutus Salad
author: Chef John
summary: Watch your back, Caesar! This salad could be the next national favorite and was inspired by a salad I had at a seafood restaurant in Healdsburg, CA. With apple slices, romaine lettuce, Cheddar cheese, fresh herbs, toasted pecans, and Dijon vinaigrette, it's amazing.
ingredients: ¼ cup real French Dijon mustard
1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
4  hearts of romaine, cut or torn into bite-size pieces
2 ounces extra sharp aged Cheddar cheese
directions: Place Dijon mustard, vegetable oil, seasoned rice vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, pepper, and cayenne into a bowl
Whisk thoroughly until well blended, about a minute
Place pecans in a skillet over medium heat
Cook and stir until pecans smell toasty and have darkened slightly, 1 or 2 minutes
Sprinkle with kosher salt and sugar
Cook and stir another minute; remove from heat
Transfer to a plate to cool
Place romaine pieces into a large bowl
Add apple slices, dill, tarragon, and a handful of pecans, reserving some for garnish
Grate Cheddar lightly onto salad, reserving some for garnish
Drizzle in some dressing and toss
Taste and add more salt or dressing if desired
You make not need all of the dressing
Garnish with a few toasted pecans and some grated Cheddar cheese
